title.bibl: Revyen, Jan. 26, 1901. [New Lodge of Danish Brotherhood Formed]

notesStmt.note: Transcribed from digital images contributed to the Internet Archive by the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign.

sourceDesc.bibl: Chicago Foreign Language Press Survey, 1936-1941, Works Projects Administration, Chicago Public Library Omnibus Project

div.bibl: Revyen, Jan. 26, 1901. [NEW LODGE OF DANISH BROTHERHOOD FORMED]

body.p: A new lodge of the Danish Brotherhood was started in Chicago Sunday, January 13, Lodge No. 140, Moreland, Chicago. Present were the supreme secretary, Viggo A. Danielsen, and Mr. W. Kikkebusch, president of Lodge No. 17.
The new board was elected from among the twenty-four charter members. Holger Stuhr was elected president; Rolf Rasmussen, vice-president; John Scroeder, secretary; and Andrew Jensen, treasurer.
